intro: Gymnanthemum triflorum, commonly known as the three-flowered gymnanthemum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped. Gymnanthemum triflorum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
